Between 1990 and 2019, growth in emissions was relatively slow in Europe, Asia
rth America while it was unprecedently fast in other regions. Driven by
economic and population growth, the annual growth rates in East Asia, South Asia, South East Asia,
and Africa were 6.1%, 5.2%, 4.7%, and 4.1%, respectively. Latin America and the Middl
seen somewhat slower growth in transport

. While alternative lighter powertrains have great potential for
mitigating GHG emissions from cars, the trend has been towards increasing vehicle size and engine
power within all vehicle size classes, driven by consumer preferences towards larger
. On a global scale, SUV sales ha
ve been constantly growing in the last

current emissions from the transport sector (2%) and are associated with electrification of certain modes

emitting modes. These strategies include more
